title: 13.5g Strength Focus

brewing_steps.audio_script: Pour 200 grams of water. Take your paddle and stir 5 times to ensure even wetting. The slightly higher dose gives this cup more punch.
Insert the plunger to create a seal and let it steep. We are going for a shorter brew time here to keep acidity high and avoid heavy bitterness.
At 1 minute 30, begin pressing. Aim to finish by the 2-minute mark. This quick brew highlights brightness and body.

what_to_expect.description: A slightly up-dosed recipe (13.5g) for those who prefer a bit more strength and body than the standard 12g cup. The shorter brew time and lower temperature (90°C) keep it smooth and avoid harshness.
what_to_expect.audio_script: If you find standard recipes a bit watery, this one is for you. With 13.5 grams of coffee and a shorter brew time, we aim for a punchy, vibrant cup with great body, perfect for starting your morning.

notes: Adjust grind coarser if it feels too heavy.
